me.utk.networking

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.utk.networking.Client

  • public abstract class Client
extends Object
    A static wrapper for a singular ClientImplementation instance.

    This class provides a single static instance of a ClientImplementation, which can be instantiated via the initialize(boolean) and initialize(Supplier) methods.

    Additionally, all of the methods implemented by a ClientImplementation can be accessed via the corresponding static methods offered by this class.

    Version:
    December 8, 2020
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam
    See Also:
    initialize(boolean), initialize(Supplier), ClientImplementation

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static boolean initialize(boolean useNewIO)
        Initializes this abstract class's ClientImplementation instance to a default implementation using either Java's New or Old IO API.

        This method initializes the client using a default NIO or OIO implementation (from NewIO_Client or OldIO_Client).

        Resolving the old client implementation via the ClientImplementation.closeClient() method is left as a task for the user.

        Parameters:
        useNewIO - Whether to use Java's New or Old IO API
        Returns:
        true, if the current client was replaced (as outlined in initialize(Supplier)'s documentation; otherwise, false
        See Also:
        initialize(Supplier), NewIO_Client, OldIO_Client, ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.closeClient()

      • initialize

        public static boolean initialize(Supplier<ClientImplementation> server)
        Initializes this abstract class's ClientImplementation instance to the provided implementation, provided it is not null.

        Resolving the old client implementation via the ClientImplementation.closeClient() method is left as a task for the user.

        Parameters:
        server - A supplier which provides a new ClientImplementation
        Returns:
        true, if the provided ClientImplementation is not null; otherwise, false
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.closeClient()

      • exists

        public static boolean exists()
        Returns whether or not the static ClientImplementation is instantiated.
        Returns:
        true if the static ClientImplementation is not null; otherwise, false
        See Also:
        initialize(boolean), initialize(Supplier), ClientImplementation

      • sendMessages

        public static void sendMessages(String... messages)
        Sends the given messages to the server using implementation-specific messaging protocols.

        This method is a static wrapper for the ClientImplementation.sendMessages(String...) method.

        Parameters:
        messages - String messages to send to client
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the static ClientImplementation was not initialized
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.sendMessages(String...)

      • getMessageBuilder

        public static MessageBuilder getMessageBuilder()
        Returns the MessageBuilder associated with this client.

        This method is a static wrapper for the ClientImplementation.getMessageBuilder() method.

        Returns:
        The MessageBuilder associated with this client
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the static ClientImplementation was not initialized
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.getMessageBuilder()

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public static void setConnectionTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the amount of time to wait for server connection before timing out.

        This method is a static wrapper for the ClientImplementation.setConnectionTimeout(int) method.

        Parameters:
        timeout - Number of milliseconds until timeout
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the static ClientImplementation was not initialized
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.setConnectionTimeout(int)

      • connect

        public static boolean connect(String address,
                              int port)
        Attempts to connect to the specified network address without a passcode.

        This method is a static wrapper for the ClientImplementation.connect(String, int) method.

        Parameters:
        address - The IP address to connect to
        port - The network port to connect to
        Returns:
        true if the connection was accepted by the server; otherwise, false
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the static ClientImplementation was not initialized
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.connect(String, int)

      • connect

        public static boolean connect(String address,
                              int port,
                              String passcode)
        Attempts to connect to the specified network address with the specified passcode.

        This method is a static wrapper for the ClientImplementation.connect(String, int, String) method.

        Parameters:
        address - The IP address to connect to
        port - The network port to connect to
        passcode - The passcode to use to connect
        Returns:
        true if the connection was accepted by the server; otherwise, false
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the static ClientImplementation was not initialized
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.connect(String, int, String)

      • closeClient

        public static void closeClient()
        Closes all threads and resolves all objects in use by this client.

        This method is a static wrapper for the ClientImplementation.closeClient() method.

        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the static ClientImplementation was not initialized
        See Also:
        ClientImplementation, ClientImplementation.closeClient()
